items.name: Object_Character
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Object_Character
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Object_Character extends gs.Object_Visual
    @objectCodecBlackList = ["parent"]
    ###*
    * A game object for a visual novel character. 
    *
    * @module vn
    * @class Object_Character
    * @extends gs.Object_Visual
    * @memberof vn
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: (record, data) ->
        super(data)
        
        ###*
        * The object's source rectangle on screen.
        * @property srcRect
        * @type gs.Rect
        ###
        @srcRect = new Rect()
        
        ###*
        * The object's z-index.
        * @property zIndex
        * @type number
        ###
        @zIndex = 200
    
        ###*
        * The object's mask.
        * @property mask
        * @type gs.Mask
        ###
        @mask = new gs.Mask()
        
        ###*
        * The color tone of the object used for the visual presentation.
        * @property tone
        * @type gs.Tone
        ###
        @tone = new Tone(0, 0, 0, 0)
        
        ###*
        * Indicates if the object's visual presentation should be mirrored horizontally.
        * @property mirror
        * @type boolean
        ###
        @mirror = data?.mirror ? false
        
        ###*
        * The object's image used for visual presentation.
        * @property image
        * @type string
        ###
        @image = ""
        
        ###*
        * The ID of the character-record used.
        * @property rid
        * @type number
        ###
        @rid = data?.id || (record?.index ? -1)
        
        ###*
        * The character's expression(database-record)
        * @property expression
        * @type Object
        ###
        @expression = RecordManager.characterExpressions[data?.expressionId || 0]
        
        ###*
        * The character's behavior component which contains the character-specific logic.
        * @property behavior
        * @type vn.Component_CharacterBehavior
        ###
        @behavior = new vn.Component_CharacterBehavior()
        @logic = @behavior
        
        ###*
        * The object's animator-component to execute different kind of animations like move, rotate, etc. on it.
        * @property animator
        * @type vn.Component_Animator
        ###
        @animator = new gs.Component_Animator()
        
        ###*
        * The object's visual-component to display the game object on screen.
        * @property visual
        * @type gs.Component_Sprite
        ###
        @visual = new gs.Component_Sprite()
        @visual.imageFolder = "Graphics/Characters"
        
        @addComponent(@logic)
        @addComponent(@visual)
        @addComponent(@animator)
        @componentsFromDataBundle(data)
        
        #@update()
        
     
    ###*
    * Restores the game object from a data-bundle.
    *
    * @method restore
    * @param {Object} data - The data-bundle.
    ###    
    restore: (data) ->
        super(data)
        
        @srcRect = gs.Rect.fromObject(data.srcRect)
        @mask = gs.Mask.fromObject(data.mask)
        @motionBlur = gs.MotionBlur.fromObject(data.motionBlur)
        @expression = RecordManager.characterExpressions[data?.expressionId || 0]
        
    ###*
    * Serializes the object into a data-bundle.
    *
    * @method toDataBundle
    * @return {Object} The data-bundle.
    ###   
    toDataBundle: -> 
        components = @componentsToDataBundle(gs.Component_Animation)
        
        return {
            rid: @rid, 
            dstRect: @dstRect, 
            srcRect: @srcRect,
            opacity: @opacity,
            zoom: @zoom,
            angle: @angle,
            anchor: @anchor,
            zIndex: @zIndex,
            offset: @offset,
            motionBlur: @motionBlur,
            mask: @mask.toDataBundle(),
            mirror: @mirror, 
            expressionId: @expression.index,
            components: components
        }
        

vn.Object_Character = Object_Character
